low: m_c worries over the herb stores, there isn't nearly enough for the whole Clan.
m_c doesn't think the the current herb supply can handle all the possible ailments {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates may face.
m_c tells {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates to be careful this moon, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can't afford to waste herbs on unnecessary injury.
m_c worriedly recounts the herbs; the Clan can't afford to waste even the driest leaves.
m_c looks at the herb stores and wonders if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'ll have to ask for other Clans' help.
adequate: m_c is content with how many herbs the Clan has stocked up.
It's not enough for an emergency, but m_c thinks the Clan has enough herbs for now.
This herb supply can handle most problems, though m_c wonders if it can support the Clan in every situation.
There's enough herbs for now, but m_c considers gathering some more... just in case.
Though there's plenty of room for more, m_c is happy enough with how many herbs the Clan has for now.
Though the supply is decent, m_c knows there aren't enough herbs to face an outbreak if one occurs.
full: There's plenty of herbs in the den and m_c looks over them approvingly.
m_c has the herb supply well managed, it seems like there's plenty for all manner of ailments.
m_c feels happy with the amount of herbs stored and thinks the Clan is well prepared for any emergency.
m_c looks over the stores with satisfaction; {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/feel/feels} confident that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can handle any emergency.
excess: The Clan has been blessed with plentiful herbs and m_c struggles to find places to store them all.
The herb stores are overflowing and m_c feels little worry.
The Clan has nothing to worry about, m_c has more than enough herbs for every conceivable problem.
With more herbs than places to store them, m_c wryly wonders if it's possible to have too much of a good thing.
There are so many herbs stored that m_c's only worry is finding the specific herb {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'re/'s} looking for.
